text:
One of the key reasons for my fiance and my visit to Bali was due to finding out about this unique experience/retreat. On arrival, we were floored by the amazingly unparalleled views that was not only naturally breathtaking but served as a stark contrast to our day to day of living in the hustle and bustle of a typical metropolitan city.

   To top things off was the supremely warm and family-like treatment we were given by our butler, Budi and his team of 'Supermen' and 'Superwomen' (rightfully dubbed so because of their multitasking and multitalented ability to be serving as our butler/concierge at one point of time, to being our server and at times even part of the housekeeping crew if need be at the next). We sincerely appreciate the top-notch service given to us; never was there a dull nor quiet moment as every single staff member in the residence was well versed in conversation and was very willing to partake even if we were just simply passing by. Everyone was courteous, friendly and polite to a fault. To offer a comparison to this would be as if you were staying in a local 'homestay' experience but with all the luxuries, amenities and services that is offered by a 5 star hotel.

   Our rooms were impeccably clean but with the occasional spiderwebs or bugs; we do understand though as such are the perils of staying in such a natural environment... Everything though, was kept in very and tip-top clean condition by the entirety of the cleaning crew. Dinner and breakfast served was not only healthy and natural (pretty much all of the ingredients save a few were harvested from the vicinity of the residences where they're grown) but also overwhelmingly delicious especially when comparing it to typical hotel standards.

   Our experience there was pretty much perfect. Do note that because of the location and the structure of the whole residence you'll be exposed to the sounds of nature, mainly the sounds of the animals throughout the night (some more calming and relaxing while some a little more aggressive). We were quite unfortunate to have been disturbed by a feral wild cat that constantly circled our villa after having made our area more or less it's home. If you are not a fan of the perils of such a natural environment, you will need to prep yourself.
title: A Retreat That You'll Have to Experience at Least Once in Your Life

text:
After a difficult ‘welcome and orientation’ we settled into an amazing room and acclimated to our stay in the Balinese jungle. After a 2 hour drive we arrived at this extremely remote resort. The biggest issue was that our guide did not speak or understand enough English to prepare us for how different this resort is.  All of the walks are made of very uneven rocks , some on steep , wet inclines. The lifts are open air and there is a slight learning curve for operating them. I was very concerned about taking the lift and the paths at night where it is VERY dimly lit. Indeed we did get stuck one time on the lift but they did come to help within 5 minutes. My advice for a better “welcome” for guests would be to have an ‘orientation’ upon arrival BEFORE you head to the villa. Our guide tried to tell us all about it while we were walking to the room. She was so soft spoken we couldn’t hear her ( because the resort is open air you have to speak quietly) plus you had to walk single file so the last person hears NONE of it. 
ONCE was were acclimated it was easy to appreciate the beauty of this place. The 
Chefs preparations each evening were works of ART! The food was delicious and we loved trying all the local plant based menu options! The cooling system over the bed was awesome. Wish I had one at home! Puspa the manager was very nice to speak with and did a wonderful job with any request we had.
title: Difficult intro to a beautiful resort and experience

text:
From the moment of arrival, we felt instantly relaxed and excited to begin our holiday. It was lovely chatting to the Resort Manager Puspa and hearing stories about the Buahan journey thus far from an insider's point of view. Buahan's commitment to sustainability, fostering community and encouraging guests to be at one with nature are highly commendable.

For us it's the amazing people, exceptional food and unique experiences that made our stay truly wonderful and unforgettable. A special mention goes to De Gus, our host who was professional, friendly, engaging and always anticipated our needs. On numerous occasions he went out his way to make sure we were comfortable and well taken care of.

Special thanks to Chef Eka and Chef Agus for the mouth watering meals they prepared for us. We love the concept of 70% plant based, and also the opportunity to go foraging for ingredients, we have learnt so much!

A few tips and must do's to share based on our experience:
- Tjampuhan Waterfall Trek --> Descend down gravel pathways and you'll be rewarded with Buahan's own private waterfall, beautiful and mesmerising. 
- Pop-up lunch at Tegal Dukuh, Taro Village -->  The perfect blend of culture, adventure, education and of course, delicious food.
- Yoga @ the Pavilion --> Best way to start your day, breathe in the peace and tranquility, practising yoga amongst the lush forest and greenery.
- Cocktail hour @ Botanist Bar --> Enjoy the 'Salak' Cocktail (whiskey sour with a Buahan twist!) during sunset 
- Subak Buahan Trek -->  A delightful trek exploring local plants and flora, finishing with a stroll through paddy rice fields. 

Last but not least, if you're reading this review and researching a resort to stay at in Bali, look no further and book Buahan - it is truly one of a kind, an experience like no other!
title: Exceptional & unforgettable experience!

text: My husband and I booked a trip to this resort after we saw it online and saw how unique it looked. Wow! We had such an INCREDIBLE experience. Staff was SO professional and friendly. The service was outstanding and they made us feel so special and welcomed. The staff memorized our names from the moment we stepped out of the car to the day we left. The resort was lush and exotic. We stayed in room 16 (The Riverside Jungle Pool Bale) and it was perfect and private. Every detail in the room was considered, from hats, raincoats, to bug spray and sunscreen. Our bale was the closest to the waterfall so we really enjoyed walking there in the mornings. We were happy with how open the bale is and how there were plenty of drapes and curtains for protection at night. You will see bugs but we never experienced any in the sleeping area. The high powered AC/fan over the bed kept us nice and cool at night. The cell phone in the room was clever and helped us get around and communicate with staff. The resort is very peaceful when it rains but rocks can get super slippery and you will get a little wet so be careful when walking around. The yoga classes were perfect (thank you Made and Jana). We also did a few activities such as the foraging with mixologist Rudi and Rice Lift Trekking. We really enjoyed both. The guides were excellent and even helped us take photos. The ladies at the spa gave the best massages. I enjoyed that there were 4 different spa massage areas. Therapists Yanti, Koming, and Katek were amazing. We really enjoyed the Island Pijat massages. Dining at the resort was interesting but in a good way. Breakfast had a nice variety of fresh foods and drinks. Dinner changed daily and we enjoyed trying unique new combinations. Food was very fresh and the best part was knowing most was grown right on the property.  Riska and Ir were great servers! One of the best parts about the resort is that each staff member has several roles so everyone is willing to help you. Olive was an  amazing host and did a great job coordinating all of our needs. Other memorable staff was Yana, Budi, and June. Thank you everyone for such an incredible trip. The tree planting ceremony was also such a special treat and we can't wait to come back and visit our guava tree! Overall we were extremely happy with our experience and could not thank the amazing staff enough!
title: Unique, Exotic, Most Memorable Experience!

OUTSTANDING.
This truly is a hidden gem. We went to Buahan on our honeymoon and had the most incredible time. It really felt like an experience of a lifetime staying in our luxury accommodation - with no walls & outdoor showers - you are fully submerged in the jungle,  with animal noises all around. For those who love the outdoors, but want to be 'at one with nature' in the most luxurious way - this is a no brainer. The service is the best we have ever experienced: personal, attentive, polite, friendly - the hotel staff were all exceptional. We had a cooking class and went foraging with chef Surya Antara, who showed us how to cook local Indonesian cuisine. Surya went above and beyond to cook us a personalised meal of our choice and to let us watch him in action in the kitchen at dinner time. He is a truly talented chef - his food was a real highlight. All food was locally sourced  - we were not prepared for the degree of high quality included in half board - exquisite food and a reason to stay in Buahan alone. 
We went on a jungle trek and waterfall trek with Jana - who was an excellent guide and showed us the local rice fields and village. We had a fantastic time and cant recommend enough!
We would come back to Bali just for Buahan! In all, exceptional!

text:
The Buahan Escape is a very unique place you may keep away from the noise of the world, at least for a while. A bit challenging when we booked this stay during our trip to Denpasar in November, I and my wife like Bali especially the Ubud and we come to stay in deferent villas in past years. This no window no wall experience we did some pre-study and finally would have a try. Have to say the feeling of touching the pure nature with 0 distance was so fantastic, you may not really worry about the weather no matter sunny or raining, always you can feel the peace, like the world stops and you are part of the nature. Besides the very specially designed villa made us comfortable stay, a group of very kind and lovely staff there took care of us very well, Mr.Yaya, Jonny, Pudu, Ms.Monica, Olive, and other I could not remember their names, those smiles are still in my memory even after I back to home nearly a month. 
We had booking of two nights but finally extended one more night to have further joy with the nature and people there, trust me that, if you are looking for a place where helps you escape for a while, here it is. Actually, you don't need to do anything, just stay, smell the atmosphere, look at sky, the rice terrace, the mountain from far, and fogs around, hear the birds and insects, plus if you have a glass of wine in hand, perfect.  We did not join many activities the villa offered, but the water falls which privately belongs to the villa better go and check. Out of all, my greatest memory was the tree planting, for celebrating my birthday. 
Heard their future plan for the firefly house near the villa will be ready next year, expect a night flying show very soon, may consider coming back then for it, and visit the tree I planted. 
To be honest, the staying here is a bit costly, anyway I think it's worthy for the unique choice. Thanks again my friends there, for your smiles and sweet accompany, hope to see you all soon.

text: One of the best vacations I have had.  I was very attracted by the "one with nature" theme, and the gorgeous views as seen on the website.  However, i was a bit worried about bugs - particularly mosquitoes as I attract them and i did not wish to stay inside the netted bed all the time.  For all of you worried about the same thing - there is no problem with bugs at all.  the rooms are surrounded by plants that ward off some of the bugs, particularly mosquitos.  and with regular application of the bug spray the hotel provides (all natural and smells great), I didn't get bitten at all and believe me mosquitoes love me.  The resort exceeded my expectations in every other aspect as well.  The room is amazing, I had Bale #1, with a view just like the pictures on the website.   This being the rainy season there's a thunderstorm almost every day around 1-3pm, like clock work, and watching and listening to the rain is the most relaxing thing I have ever done.  After the rain, mists rise from the valley floor and gently waft across the tree tops, and above the mist, we can still see the 7 peaks of the distant mountain.  The food is amazing, as many previous reviews have noted.  Not only the ingredient is delicious and fresh from the local farms (or the garden in the resort), the cooking is amazing.  The staff is absolutely brilliant - knowledgeable, friendly, helpful and world class.
title: Unique experience of a life time

text:
A special experience booked for my birthday and an anniversary treat as the last 4 nights of our SE Asia trip! We journeyed from Spain, so this was no couple-hour flight from within the region!

I specifically wanted a forest immersion, and I can assure you villa #19 is just that :) Thundering waterfall sounds rising up from below the villa and a range of forest creature noises was pretty close to a Tarzan and Jane experience. We loved it!

Pretty much only superlatives to share. The villa is cleverly designed to create a perfect nest of luxury with maximum exposure to nature. We wanted for nothing, and it was a struggle to swap the villa robes for regular attire to venture into the real world at times :)

The food was amazing, and I would not do any of it justice by trying to describe it. But suffice it to say, whether you're tucking into melt-in-your-mouth beef or pork, sampling homemade jams/compotes with banana bread, or one of the many fusion dishes (which change every few days), Chef Eka and team will ensure you're in for a treat.

We loved the attentiveness of the team (maybe a little too much in one or two instances). We didn't get everyone's name, but special thanks to Budi for taking care of details and special touches (like when I was struggling with a bad cold, ginger teas were appearing regularly), and Olive for making meals even more fun and friendly!

Tip: #19 is ideal for total forest immersion and privacy. It is deep in the valley, at the end of the track, and just above the waterfall (which you can hear but not see). 

Downside: if you want quiet nature, it is probably better to be higher up the hill (also better for hill views). The waterfall can be noisy (but quickly became background noise for us), and the cicadas were deafening (they were the loudest I have ever heard and at times sounded like an alarm blast :o
title: An escape to jungle heaven

text:
Rooms: Wow what a stunning, one-of-a-kind experience. Going to sleep to the sounds of the jungle, and then waking up to birdsong and views of the valley foliage was breathtaking. The rooms were thoughtfully designed, spacious, and well appointed. We easily spent all day lounging around the gazebo, the pool, the sofa, the ledge, the bathtub. Coming back in the evening after the turn down service was like coming home to our very own treehouse. We didn't want to leave. Each detail was lovingly curated, from the tee & coffee selection, to the Bali groni, even the lush bathroom amenities which were sustainably sourced and packed. (The only hiccup was when we thought the sustainably refilled bath candle wax was bath salt.. oops! xD) We were thoroughly impressed by how the villas were constructed in the middle of the jungle, and the care taken to upkeep the purity of the ecosystem and the condition of the property.

Activities: The daily program and charming team brought the whole experience together for us. Every activity was fun and revealed a new facet of Balinese culture. Each host was passionate and knowledgeable, answering all our questions about Balinese fruit, gods, folklore, traditions, geography, family life, pets. We laughed a lot, and it really felt like a family. We enjoyed the variety of activities - we did scrub making, life-trekking, moon yoga, waterfall trek, foraging, sunrise yoga. Highlights were the treks and standing under the waterfall. We also loved dipping in the villa and main pool. Just enough to push us out of our comfort zone and help us feel more present and mindful.

Food: we loved the creative menu. Fresh ingredients from the garden and local village fused together in an engaging, interactive open kitchen. Breakfast was excellent: continental and local options with a smorgasbord of Bali coffee, pineapple kombucha, moringa loloh, with the freshest selection of watermelon, dragon fruit, passion fruit, tangerine juice. Soursop, jackfruit, and mango Jam, pesto butter with seriously the most delicious seeded multi-grain and banana bread loaves. (I felt much closer to my cucumber salad after foraging for the lemon basil garnish myself and I think that's the point of a mindfulness retreat.) We were impressed by how the team was able to whip up anything we wanted to eat, even summoning fresh durian on request. Chef Eka even explained to us the various dishes in the context of the Galungan festival, while serving up some of the best Babi Guling and Bebek we've ever tasted.

People: We absolutely adored the close-knit team who welcomed us and made us feel at home. We enjoyed the conversations with Puspa, Suwana, Budi, Olive, Handy, Eka, Adi, Suria and others who went out of their way to enrich our time there. Each shared their own life stories, which added a special touch to the experience. We can't wait to come back for the next naked adventure
title: Naked Experience

text:
My experience staying at Buahan has made me feel like my previous 5 star reviews for other places have all been overrated. The Buahan team have absolutely set a new standard for hospitality and what they've created is something that they should all be incredibly proud of. The food, drinks and in particular the service was nothing short of impeccable! 

Every possible detail was covered and the team were one of the most accommodating that I have ever experienced.
The 'no-walls, no-doors' concept is unique yet so well executed with all the comfort you would expect of a 5 star resort. We were a bit unsure how it would be leading up to our stay, there's definitely all sorts of bugs around of course, but the rooms are set up in a way that they don't bother you in the slightest.

I couldn't write this review without making specific mention of the food! It was absolutely incredible with every meal being a unique experience with fresh local ingredients that I often found myself thinking wouldn't go well together, yet we were repeatedly surprised by the most amazing dishes at every meal. There was nothing that I didn't like nor was there anything that I thought just tasted average, it was all incredible.
The portions appear small when they come out but we left feeling completely content with each meal and repeatedly shocked at the incredible dining experience. The same can be said for the cocktails which were all truly unique and delicious.

Literally the only complaint that I could think of is that the villa pools were quite cold but that didn't stop us from having an amazing stay and dipping our toes in.

We had an incredible honeymoon stay here and will be recommending Buahan to anyone who will listen when we return to Perth. I'm writing this review whilst sitting in our pool villa in a well known 5 star hotel in Seminyak at a similar price point. The experience we're having here has got nothing on our stay at Buahan!

We would particularly like to thank Puspa, Arsana, Ollie, Riska and Budi. There were too many amazing staff that made our stay special to name you all but thankyou so much for an amazing honeymoon and for making our stay so special. It's something that we'll remember for a long time.

We look forward to getting back there one day soon.
title: The gold standard for hospitality!

To be honest we were never a fan of the Banyan Tree Group cause we always think that the brand is just another Aman wannabe like Como and Alila. But this new Escape concept proved we are wrong, or nearly wrong!

The manager Puspa told us that Escape is kind of a sub-brand of Banyan Tree with possibility of expanding the Escape brand further around the globe. Eka, we don't know whether we should call him chef or guide, is hospitality in the shape of a man! He listen to you, he knows what's in the area, he cooked very well, he talked with us like an old friend, he accompanied us exploring the Buahan area and explain so many things about plants, poultry, even the culture. We also love the traditional kitchen concept of the resort which make the experience more real with no gimmick.

Overall, we had a great time staying here, and our stay was a memorable one cause it was enlightening. We learned so many new things without being preached by the staff. We went back to Singapore feeling inspired, relaxed, and thankful. Truly a one of a kind experience!

text:
If you have an opportunity to go to Bali, please go to Buahan.

THE FOOD
The food was probably a highlight of the trip.  It's all very fresh, seasonal and local.  
Breakfast is a series of small dishes which you can have all of - or a selection.   My husband and I tried most of the dishes at breakfast and skipped lunch.  There is also a breakfast bar which has fruits, pastries, breads, cold meat and cheese etc.

Dinner is a multicourse meal.

The food has a vegetarian focus, but includes a meat option at dinner in the main course, and featured in breakfast.

The food was fantastic, a real highlight of the trip.  Eka the chef is very skilled, passionate and really advocates for local produce - he is a treasure.

THE ROOM
We stayed in a riverfront villa, if you are coming I would get one of these rooms if possible, they are the most private.  It's a bit of a hike to your room, but well worth it.

Lets talk about the bugs.  While an extraordinary effort is done to keep the bugs at bay, you are in the jungle and there are no walls - so you will have bugs.  There is a turndown service where they will put up a wall essentially of fly nets - and there's a second layer of these over bed.  It's very effective, we had no real issues with mosquitos in our bed.

The bed has a aircon device above it - which essentially blows cold air onto you - this is surprisingly effective - I don't handle the heat well when I'm sleeping, but honestly had no issues at night with this device running.  So don't worry there.

The pool is cold, too cold for us, we didn't use it.  I also don't think a property like this doesn't need a pool - we didn't miss not being able to use it.  The general manager did comment on this when we were checking out - they are looking at options to heat the pool, but I imagine that will be a challenge.

The bath in the room makes up for the cold pool - it was lovely to enjoy in the morning - and is easily big enough for two people.

STUFF TO DO
We only stayed three nights, and we didn't love the resort.  We availed ourselves of some of the included activities, I would highly recommend the foraging with the Chef.

My husband and I both had a 60 minute massage, it was easily the best massage of the holiday, and probably one of the best massages I've ever had.  

There is a shuttle to Ubud, but we never used it.

Things to note:
If you are mobility impaired I would have a discussion with the hotel before booking - there are LOTS of steps, it's quite steep.  There is an inclinator, but it only gets you so far around.

The resort is a good 2 hours from the airport, and it's probably 20 minutes from Ubud, so it is remote.  I would go and just not leave though :)

Last but not least, I want to mention the staff.  Everyone is very friendly, eager to help and while there were some issues occasionally with slow service to get a second drink or someone asking you the same question - this is all very minor and probably partly due to the fact that the hotel has only been open properly for a few months.
title: Once in a lifetime experience

text:
We spent 4 nights in a riverside jungle pool villa.
Villa: it was the closest villa to the river fall, with absolute privacy. One thing to think about: water fall may be somewhat noisy. We loved it but this is about personal taste… The villa was very well equipped with a real look for details (e.g the air refresher above the bed). The curtains/mosquito nets were very efficient. We did not worry any second about the true openness of the villa into the rainforest. The villa pool was not heated.
Food: the food was just exquisite (breakfast, lunch, dinner). The chefs were really interested in sharing their passion for cooking. They offered specials (not on the menus) and were showing/explaining their (mostly local) ingredients… have you ever seen and tasted a banana blossom? Just amazing!
Activities: various activities were proposed (biking, hiking, yoga). Exercising level was rather easy (at least for us :) ), even if some paths may be really steep (with some percentages well above 20%). The spa was attractive, and we appreciated the quality of the treatments.
Finally, the team… all team members were genuinely willing to be nice and helpful. While they may still acquire a bit of experience (August 2022), we are certain they will be the key of the success of this magnificent destination.
One minus: there was no gym.
Overall the price-quality ratio was good.
title: Nature and refinement!

text:
What a dream it was to visit this piece of paradise just outside of Ubud. every moment was special and unique. We stayed for two nights and got to experience a deeper connection to Bali, its villages, nature, and people. At Buahan you are welcomed as part of the family and it is true, you feel like you are at home. 

The kitchen was of the highest caliber. It is an open concept so that you can walk right in and see how the dishes are prepared. The food itself and every cocktail were outstanding, without a doubt the best we've had in Bali. The kitchen is run by Eka, an internationally trained chef who grew up in this region and approaches every ingredient with love and understanding. Each leaf and flower is placed with purpose so that every bite is filled with flavours and textures that never cease to amaze. Eka took us into the nearby village to visit the farmers and teach us how everything is grown, foraged, and prepared. We had the opportunity to taste a multitude of spectacular fruits, dishes, and worms! Yes, worms. I enjoyed this, but it's not for everyone. After that was the cooking class and then lunch. Each moment unforgettable. 

On sight were also daily yoga classes, a private waterfall, tours of the rice paddy, and endless possibilities. The room itself was the most beautiful and peaceful I've seen in Bali. If I could rate this property 10 stars I would.

Thank you Puspa for this marvelous time and I am already looking forward to my return.
title: Nothing Short of Paradise

text:
“An invitation into a new way of being” 

I was intrigued almost immediately by the tagline of Banyan Tree Escape at Buahan and I wanted to discover for myself if those lofty words match the experiences that it claims to deliver. 

It did …… and it was everything and more.

As a seasoned traveller to Banyan Tree hotels around the world, my partner and I expect nothing less than the usual standard, luxury and attention to details associated with the hotel chain. I must admit… I was initially skeptical of how much more Banyan Tree can do to woo and wow me. That immediately changed when we stepped out of the vehicle and strolled towards our villa for the check-in. Walking along the stone path that led to our Buahan Valley Pool Vale, it dawned on us that we were literally in the middle of a jungle in Bali… and we were going to stay there for 2 nights – sans the “protection” of walls!

And there it was in front of us – Villa Number 12. Pushing open the floating panelled door, we were greeted with a breathtaking and picturesque view of our villa and its accompanying rainforest view! As our villa host led us up the steps to our villa, we could not help taking in the sights of our private infinity pool with its sparkling emerald water and instantly made a mental note to jump into it. 

Everything about the villa was perfect… it was extremely open yet comfortingly private, bright and sunny yet at the same time cool and breezy. There were so many details to take in as we walked by our living/ lounge area to our bedroom and then finally to our dressing/bath area. Adopting a luxurious brown, white and copper colour tone, the interiors of the villa complemented the vibrant green hues of the jungle beautifully. With a 180-degree view of the seven peak mountains in the horizon, it was Mother Nature’s Ultra-HD TV at its best, right from the comforts of our own villa!

Despite living in Singapore, heat and humidity are my twin nemesis and I was extremely concerned about how we were going to spend our 2 nights in a dense tropical jungle in the summer month of June! My initial fear was immediately put to rest when I realised that behind our king-sized bed was an attached air-conditioner. To my delight, it blows out cold air which in turn got channelled up a “sail-looking” covering above us such that when we sleep, the air descends gently hence cooling us immediately. Closing the translucent drapes around our bed, we were cocooned within our own little paradise, cool and sheltered from the heat and the occasional harmless insects curious to check us out (we were in the jungle… insects come with the territory!) 

We were initially concerned that we would get woken up too early by the sun rays in the morning and hence came prepared with eyeshades. Although blinds around the villa were available to shield the morning sun, we did not utilise it as we wanted to fully embrace the whole “no walls, no doors” concept. We ended up waking refreshed at 8.30 am the next morning… not from the sun rays but gently coaxed from our restful slumber by nature’s very own symphony.

During our stay, we treated ourselves to the signature treatment at the Toja Spa to pamper ourselves. Aptly named “Buahan Bliss”, the treatment utilised local herbs and spices sourced from the region, and it consisted of a dry body brush, a stimulating massage and a detoxifying body wrap. For 2 hours, we surrendered our body, mind and soul to our masseuses and walked away feeling recharged and revitalised. Sipping a hot cup of tea while looking out at the rice fields from our treatment villa, time stood still as we felt reconnected with nature.

Not many hotels I know can boast of having their very own private waterfall. However, Banyan Tree Escape at Buahan can. Armed with a walking stick and comfortable shoes, our guide led us down to Banyan Tree Escape’s very own waterfall situated right at its backyard – a pleasant 20 to 30 minutes trek. It is by no means a thunderous and majestic waterfall in the likes of Victoria Falls and Niagara Falls. Instead, what we were presented with was a “boutique” waterfall about 5 storeys tall… personal, private but approachable. Waterfall rappelling or destination dining in the future perhaps…? 

Next… the food and beverage! Breakfast is undoubtedly the most important meal of the day, and I would like to say that I was extremely glad to have stayed at Banyan Tree Escape as I really enjoyed the breakfast spread there! The food was both tasty and healthy – an oxymoron to some but it’s true! In our previous trip to Bali, we had the pleasure of dining at Locavore, one of Indonesia’s top restaurants and we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. To my delight, I was happy to learn that Banyan Tree Escape has partnered with Locavore and the result - innovative and delicious cuisine and cocktails with ingredients sourced from the mountains and grown from Banyan Tree’s own garden. By the way… the moringa latte is a must-try and to die-for! 

Dinner was also another highlight at the Open Kitchen and looking at the food presented, we were disappointed initially to know that the menu is predominantly plant-based! My partner and I are pretty much carnivores and vegetables to us are generally relegated to the “garnishes” category. To our surprise, we actually found ourselves liking and enjoying the daily dinner set menus there! The ingenious use of fresh, local ingredients coupled with the expert culinary skills of the chefs were definitely key reasons for the wonderful food. Kudos to Mr Eka for inspiring and leading his culinary team into delighting guests with their passion and service excellence.

All in all, our 2 nights spent at Banyan Tree Escape Buahan though not life-changing, were enough to make us step back and re-evaluate what sustainable eco-luxury means to us. My partner and I both love luxury accommodation and we are not ashamed of saying that. However, we also love exploring new adventures and immersing ourselves in exotic cultures and the local communities. Hence, it is great to know that there is now Banyan Tree Escape to help bridge the gap and allow us to reconnect with nature, rediscover ourselves and yet, not forgoing the creature comfort that we have been used to. 

During our stay, we had the opportunity to chat with the Hotel Manager, Ms Puspa. We were impressed with her passion and enthusiasm for Banyan Tree Escape’s direction and future.  We are certain that Escape at Buahan will help set the standards for future Escape properties and redefine what eco-luxury and sustainability mean. Under Ms Puspa’s leadership, the team had shown us such great hospitality and we constantly felt pampered from the moment we checked into the property till we left. Thank you for making Villa 12 our home away from home and for all the HARD work and HEART work from the staff!
title: At one with Nature while not forgoing Luxury

text:
The Buahan Tree Escape was breathtaking, serene, and luxury. All of the staff was extremely welcoming and accommodating from the time we landed in Bali throughout out stay and departure. One of the most refreshing experiences was waking up in the morning. We stayed in the Valley Bali “suite” overlooking the treetops of the forest green jungle with a direct view of the seven mountain peaks which placed us nearly eye level to the clouds. 

The Bali “suite” setup is 360 degrees open to the outdoors. The bathroom is equipped with double shower heads and a deep vintage copper tub that sits nearly on the deck so you can soak with the best view. Turndown service is available upon request and the king size ceiling to floor canopy bed has “evening breeze” technology.  Although the nights were cool, the evening breeze ensured we kept the temperature at our desired level. 

The food was immaculate! The use of local herbs, fruits, and harvest was evident in the quality taste and creativity of each dish prepared for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. The kitchen offered a set course menu, but a traditional menu selection was available as well. We ordered duck for dinner and it was prepared and cooked to perfection! 

For 90% of the trip, we remained onsite and relaxed by the communal resort style pool, suite pool and cabana, hiked down to the waterfall, mingled in the “living room” restaurant, and got a zen yoga experience! The waterfall hike is a must! 

The spa was equally calming as any other part of the property, opened to the jungle valley and you can hear the waterfall because it’s located at the lower level of the resort. The masseuse was very professional and did an excellent job! 

The energy, spiritual connection, and divinity flows from the foundation of the resort to the chef’s dishes and waiter’s smiles. Every single person was impactful in this life changing experience/ vacation :). I defiantly hope to return in 5 years or sooner to see how the planted trees have developed and grown. 

~Your first Bapak and Ibu guest 🤎
title: Breathtaking, Serene, and Luxury!

text:
Das Buahan Banyantree Escape setzt neue Maßstäbe, indem es die Annehmlichkeiten und den Service eines 5-Sterne Resorts mit der spektakulären Natur Balis in Einklang bringt. Dies geschieht durch ein nachhaltiges ökologisches Konzept, dass ich in keiner Weise als Einschränkung, sondern absolut als Bereicherung erfahren habe.
 
Ich hatte eine Valley View Villa unweit des Restaurants mit einem fantastischen Ausblick. Mir kam es dort immer etwas kühler und luftiger vor als im Tal, weshalb ich mich vermutlich wieder für diese Kategorie entscheiden würde.
 
Mit den Geräuschen des Waldes einzuschlafen und morgens mit Vogelgezwitscher aufzuwachen war ein echtes Erlebnis. Die Sorge, dass sich aufgrund der offenen Architektur vielbeinige Störenfriede einschleichen könnten, erwies sich als unbegründet.
 
Das Resort bietet verschiedene Aktivitäten an. Ich bin leider nur dazu gekommen, den Wasserfall und das Glühwürmchen Sanctuary zu besuchen, da ich den Fehler gemacht habe, Buahan für einen Halbtagesausflug zu verlassen. Der Tagesablauf wurde beiläufig in einem netten Gespräch beim Essen geplant, so dass ich weder das Gefühl hatte, mich zu langweilen oder in Freizeitstress zu geraten.
 
Ich habe selten einen so persönlichen und perfekten Service erlebt. Zum Beispiel fand ich ein offen auf meinem Nachttisch zurückgelassenes Buch bei der Rückkehr vom Abendessen geschlossen mit einem hauseigenen Lesezeichen wieder.
 
Das Essen hat meine Erwartungen bei weitem übertroffen! Sowohl die Auswahl zum Frühstück als auch die kreativen und leckeren Kreationen aus lokalen Produkten haben mich begeistert. Jede Mahlzeit war ein einzigartiges Erlebnis, und mir läuft heute noch das Wasser im Mund zusammen, wenn ich daran zurückdenke.
 
Wer auf der Suche nach Ruhe und Natur ist, aber dennoch nicht auf Komfort verzichten möchte, wird sich hier sicher wohlfühlen.

text:
저는 2022년 11월 27일부터 29일까지 어머니와 함께 묵었어요. 
반얀트리에서 새로운 컨셉으로 연 호텔이라는걸 여러 매체를 통해 어느 정도 접하고 갔기 때문에 기대와 걱정을 안고 체크인을 했습니다. 
2박을 하면서 느꼈던 부아한의 여러 점 가운데 가장 만족스러운 점은 역시나 정글 뷰입니다. 
그것은 어느 곳에서도 쉽사리 경험하지 못할 대자연의 모습을 한껏 느낄 수 있었습니다.
(수영장이 온수로 변경되면 더 좋을 것 같아요.)
두번째로 버틀러 서비스가 매우 만족스러웠습니다.
부아한에서는 각각의 손님마다 버틀러를 고용하고 있었는데 저희를 맡았던 Budi라는 친구가 체크인때부터 체크아웃까지, 그리고 다른 호텔로 옮기고 나서도 정말 너무나 세심하고 기분좋게 케어해주어서 진심으로 감동하고 또 고마웠습니다.(꽃다발을 딜리버리 해줬어요!)
부아한에 묵으면서 한가지 다소 아쉬웠던건 그곳에서 아침,저녁 제공되는 음식들이었어요.
그것은 자연주의 위주의 음식들이었는데 제 입맛에는 좀 맞지 않았어요..그리고 한국 사람들에겐 그러한 스타일에 대해 호불호가 나뉠 것 같았습니다.
선택지가 조금 더 넓어지면 오시는 손님들이 부아한을 통해 더 큰 만족감을 가지지 않을까 싶습니다.
우붓지역은 첫 방문이었는데 좋은 기억을 안고 갑니다.
(특별히 Budi !진심으로 고마웠어요~)

text:
En arrivant dans le lobby surplombant une vallée luxuriante, il est annoncé qu’il ne s’agit ni d’un hôtel, ni de villas. 
C’est alors que nous découvrons depuis notre cabane avec piscine, la vue sur la vallée et le sublime panorama de tous les sommets environnants. 
Un espace ouvert et de connection sans contraintes avec la nature pour un séjour ressourçant et des nuits reposantes aux sons de la forêt et de la rivière. 
C’est dans ce cadre onirique, que la puissance de la nature de l’île rencontre la gentillesse et la douceur de ses habitants. 
Merci à Puspa pour son accueil et le suivi notre séjour. 
Merci à Pandu et Arsana pour leurs sublimes cocktails. 
Merci à Riska et Olive pour leurs excellents services à table à chacun de nos repas. 
Merci à Budi, Yana et Degus d’avoir été présents à chaque instant pour répondre à tous nos besoins et contribuer à cet agréable séjour. 
Merci à Jana, pour son extrême gentillesse et son attention lors de l’excursion à la superbe cascade au pied de l’hôtel. 
Merci à Komang et Joni. 
Merci à l’équipe en cuisine pour ses délicieux menus préparés avec finesse et raffinement avec les produits de la ferme dédiée sur place. 
Merci à nos thérapeutes pour le relaxant massage face à la forêt. 
Merci aux équipes de chambres pour la propreté, la préparation et les attentions à chacun de nos retours. 
Merci à ceux qui entretiennent perpétuellement le cadre idyllique des lieux. 
Ceci n’est ni un hôtel, ni une villa, c’est une maison pleine d’harmonie et de partages avec chacun.
Des moments à vivre et revivre.
title: Un séjour d’exception

text:
Dieses Hotel sprengt alles was wir bis jetzt in Bali entdecken durften. Wir reisen oft auf die Insel und versuchen verschiedene Hotels/Resorts und Hideways aus - diese Perle hat alles übertroffen. Von den offenen Bungalows mit einer Sicht direkt in den Dschungel und auf die Berge direkt vom Bett aus bis zur Ausstattung der ganzen Anlasse, die keine Wünsche offen lässt.

Schon der Empfang war einzigartig: mit drei Schlägen auf ein Holzpendel wird man im Hotelfamilie willkommen geheissen. Und genauso fühlt es sich während dem ganzen Aufenthalt an, wie Teil einer Familie. Das Personal ist unglaublich freundlich und hilfsbereit und lässt einem einfach nur wohlfühlen. 

Das Essen war ebenfalls Weltklasse und vom Frühstück über Mittagessen zum Dinner eine Gaumenfreude. Die Küchencrew mit ihrem Chef legen grossen Wert auf regionale Produkte sowie auf deren authentische Zubereitung und überraschen jeden Tag mit neuen Kreationen, die noch dazu wunderschön dargeboten werden - ein wirklicher Genuss! Zum Abschied hat es sich der Küchenchef nicht nehmen lassen, uns seinen Garten zu zeigen und die angebauten Kräuter und Blumen, welche sie verwenden zu kosten. 

Wir kommen auf jeden Fall mit grosser Freude wieder und sind sehr gespannt, wie sich das offene Resort im Wind und Wetter halten wird.
title: WOW - was für ein Erlebnis!
